[vc_section][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”STAFF” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:center|color:%23663200″ use_theme_fonts=”yes” text_transform=”text-uppercase”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1659031791478{background-color: #662500 !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/3″ css=”.vc_custom_1659032880306{padding-right: 1px !important;}” el_class=”aa-1″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_single_image image=”417″ img_size=”450X730″ css=”.vc_custom_1660772740010{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”2/3″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text=”Devin Brown, LPC-S, LAC, NCC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_custom_heading text=”Founder of Brown Counseling” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_custom_heading text=”Licensed Professional Counselor-Supervisor” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]

Devin Brown is the Founder of Brown Counseling & Consulting, LLC. Devin earned a Bachelor of Arts in 2012 from the University of Louisiana at Lafayette. He then received his Master of Counseling Education in 2016 from Southeastern Louisiana University. Devin started working at  Woodlake Addiction Recovery Center in 2016. He was then promoted to Program and Clinical Director from 2017 – 2020 at the Woodlake Abbeville, LA location. Devin started working at Our Savior’s Church in 2020 helping with counseling and recovery ministries. Devin sees things from a Psychodynamic and Biblical perspective (when applicable). Devin is an active member and serves on the Louisiana Counseling Association as an Awards Committee Co-Chair. He is also on the Southeastern Louisiana University Advisory Council.

Devin decided to create a set of mental health journals, filled with prompts to give people a way to creatively write. His journals are on sale and can be sold through this website. Devin is now a Licensed Professional Counselor Supervisor, supervising new provisionally PLPCs, and enjoys spending time building up the employees of Brown Counseling & Consulting, LLC. One goal is to branch Brown Counseling to different parts of Louisiana and in other states. As well as opening up the consulting side, by helping other counseling practices become beneficial to servicing their communities. One fun fact about Devin is that he enjoys going to New Orleans Saint’s game!

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1659031403169{background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text=”KEYONIA IGLUS, M.S. PLPC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Provisionally Licensed Professional Counselor

Keyonia Iglus is a Provisionally Licensed Professional Counselor at Brown Counseling. Keyonia earned a Bachelors of Arts in 2002 from Dillard University. She then earned a Master of Science degree in Psychology from Purdue Global University in 2017. She also completed post graduate hours, earning a certification in addiction counseling at Post University in 2020. As well as training in Multi-systemic therapy, an intensive multi tactical treatment, assessing the impact of individual and extended systems on unhealthy behaviors. Keyonia services multicultural communities with a client focus ranging from teen to senior adult. “My mission is to prepare individuals, or groups/families to be confident in their resources, new expertise, and reliable support team to manage improved behaviors. I am drawn to this industry by my passion for learning and sharing ways to inspire myself and others. It is my duty as a professional to gain and distribute the knowledge needed to develop quality of life. I really look forward to seeing your growth throughout this journey.”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_empty_space][vc_empty_space][vc_single_image image=”615″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” disable_element=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1679674236034{background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_empty_space][vc_single_image image=”644″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_column_text]One fun fact about Keyonia is that she loves to sing and act.

When asked to Keyonia what her goals were, she replied “Teamwork is essential to intervention, therefore, providing group therapy in the workplace can be an effective plan to motivate healthy employer and staff engagement. Therefore, I plan to study the impact of therapy in the workplace. This research can enlighten employers and staff on the strengths of therapeutic access in the work setting such as assisting employee stress management, being proactive with staff interpersonal struggles, building a culture of trust to create an open forum that permits staff to address any concerns in a safe place”.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Bernell L. Elzey, Jr., M.A, LPC, NCC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Mr. Bernell Elzey, Jr., LPC, NCC earned a Bachelor of Arts in 2015 from the Univerity of New Orleans. Before transferring to the University of New Orleans, he attended the Illustrious Clark Atlanta University.  He went on to earn a Master of Arts in Counseling from the Xavier University of Louisiana in 2020.  He is a Licensed Professional Counselor, National Certified Counselor, and Certified Professional School Counselor. He is currently in the last year of his doctoral degree in Counselor Education and Supervision from the University of Holy Cross in New Orleans.  Bernell’s dissertation research focuses on Adolescent African American Males Experiencing Father Absenteeism and Its Influence on Their Interactions with Male Authority Figures.

Bernell provides clients with unconditional support to facilitate self-acceptance and teach the process of effective decision-making so that they can meet those challenges when they arise. for you in the future. I work with clients in various formats, including individually, in groups, as couples, and as families.  The theory that guides his approach to counseling is Adlerian, however, he does incorporate inventions from Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Person-Centered Therapy. Bernell has experience working with children and adults with ADHD, behavior disorders, depression, grief, interpersonal relationships concerns, and personal empowerment concerns.

 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” disable_element=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1679674247816{background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs”][vc_column_text]Within the next five years, Bernell hopes to be teaching in a Counseling Graduate Program and launching his own Wellness Practice Firm. One fun fact is that Mr. Elzey enjoys traveling and theatre.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1659031791478{background-color: #662500 !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/3″ css=”.vc_custom_1659033183535{padding-right: 1px !important;}” offset=”vc_hidden-lg vc_hidden-md”][vc_single_image image=”417″ img_size=”full” css=”.vc_custom_1632997979640{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”2/3″ offset=”vc_hidden-lg vc_hidden-md”][vc_empty_space height=”12px”][vc_custom_heading text=”Devin Brown, LPC-S, LAC, NCC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_custom_heading text=”Founder of Brown Counseling” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_custom_heading text=”Licensed Professional Counselor-Supervisor” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]

Devin Brown is the Founder of Brown Counseling & Consulting, LLC. Devin earned a Bachelor of Arts in 2012 from the University of Louisiana at Lafayette. He then received his Master of Counseling Education in 2016 from Southeastern Louisiana University. Devin started working at  Woodlake Addiction Recovery Center in 2016. He was then promoted to Program and Clinical Director from 2017 – 2020 at the Woodlake Abbeville, LA location. Devin started working at Our Savior’s Church in 2020 helping with counseling and recovery ministries. Devin sees things from a Psychodynamic and Biblical perspective (when applicable). Devin is an active member and serves on the Louisiana Counseling Association as an Awards Committee Co-Chair. He is also on the Southeastern Louisiana University Advisory Council.

Devin decided to create a set of mental health journals, filled with prompts to give people a way to creatively write. His journals are on sale and can be sold through this website. Devin is now a Licensed Professional Counselor Supervisor, supervising new provisionally PLPCs, and enjoys spending time building up the employees of Brown Counseling & Consulting, LLC. One goal is to branch Brown Counseling to different parts of Louisiana and in other states. As well as opening up the consulting side, by helping other counseling practices become beneficial to servicing their communities. One fun fact about Devin is that he enjoys going to New Orleans Saint’s game!

PLPC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Provisionally Licensed Professional Counselor

Keyonia Iglus is a Provisionally Licensed Professional Counselor at Brown Counseling. Keyonia earned a Bachelors of Arts in 2002 from Dillard University. She then earned a Master of Science degree in Psychology from Purdue Global University in 2017. She also completed post graduate hours, earning a certification in addiction counseling at Post University in 2020. As well as training in Multi-systemic therapy, an intensive multi tactical treatment, assessing the impact of individual and extended systems on unhealthy behaviors. Keyonia services multicultural communities with a client focus ranging from teen to senior adult. “My mission is to prepare individuals, or groups/families to be confident in their resources, new expertise, and reliable support team to manage improved behaviors. I am drawn to this industry by my passion for learning and sharing ways to inspire myself and others. It is my duty as a professional to gain and distribute the knowledge needed to develop quality of life. I really look forward to seeing your growth throughout this journey.”

One fun fact about Keyonia is that she loves to sing and act.

When asked to Keyonia what her goals were, she replied “Teamwork is essential to intervention, therefore, providing group therapy in the workplace can be an effective plan to motivate healthy employer and staff engagement. Therefore, I plan to study the impact of therapy in the workplace. This research can enlighten employers and staff on the strengths of therapeutic access in the work setting such as assisting employee stress management, being proactive with staff interpersonal struggles, building a culture of trust to create an open forum that permits staff to address any concerns in a safe place”.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” disable_element=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1679674263624{background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1662420376388{padding-right: 1px !important;}” offset=”vc_hidden-lg vc_hidden-md”][vc_single_image image=”644″ img_size=”full”][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text=”Bernell L. Elzey, Jr., M.A, LPC, NCC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Mr. Bernell Elzey, Jr., LPC, NCC earned a Bachelor of Arts in 2015 from the Univerity of New Orleans. Before transferring to the University of New Orleans, he attended the Illustrious Clark Atlanta University.  He went on to earn a Master of Arts in Counseling from the Xavier University of Louisiana in 2020.  He is a Licensed Professional Counselor, National Certified Counselor, and Certified Professional School Counselor. He is currently in the last year of his doctoral degree in Counselor Education and Supervision from the University of Holy Cross in New Orleans.  Bernell’s dissertation research focuses on Adolescent African American Males Experiencing Father Absenteeism and Its Influence on Their Interactions with Male Authority Figures.

Bernell provides clients with unconditional support to facilitate self-acceptance and teach the process of effective decision-making so that they can meet those challenges when they arise. for you in the future. I work with clients in various formats, including individually, in groups, as couples, and as families.  The theory that guides his approach to counseling is Adlerian, however, he does incorporate inventions from Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Person-Centered Therapy. Bernell has experience working with children and adults with ADHD, behavior disorders, depression, grief, interpersonal relationships concerns, and personal empowerment concerns.

Within the next five years, Bernell hopes to be teaching in a Counseling Graduate Program and launching his own Wellness Practice Firm. One fun fact is that Mr. Elzey enjoys traveling and theatre.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Dr. Bob utilizes expressive, in addition to psychodynamic approaches to care. Formal and informal “homework” are often used to augment the counseling experience. She works with clients in a variety of formats, including individual, group, couples and families.

Dr. Bob works with clients of all backgrounds ages 11 and up, specializing in the adolescent population. Her goal is to have her first self-help book become a National Best Seller. One fun fact is Dr. Bob loves a microphone.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Therapy” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:center|color:%23663200″ use_theme_fonts=”yes” text_transform=”text-uppercase” el_id=”therapy”]

Therapy is a process where the counselor and client can talk about any life event that has caused a change in the daily routines of life. From traumatic events like divorce, death…etc, to subtle life events like a change in jobs or buying a home. I see therapy as a place to gain insight on bettering your quality of life. From a psychodynamic perspective, I look at past events and see how it ties into your life today. In this process, my goal is to collaborate with you to help gain the necessary coping skills to add to your tool belt of life.

I specialize in helping couples or individuals overcome anxiety, depression, low self-esteem, life transitions, perfectionism, and relational issues. Also, for the last 5 years, I have specialized in helping clients focused on addiction or trauma come to a healthier place by aligning with the goals of the client.

Therapy is a collaborative process. Taking the first step to schedule a session may be intimidating or create anxiety. I encourage you to reach out for a free consultation today.

Devin BrownFounder - Brown Counseling & Consulting, LLC
